Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/2557/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/2558/
Test FAILed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

I definitely see the value of having the protocol classes. I still don't get the point of extending KafkaProducer with 5 methods that all throw UOE. This is trivial to do it in the branch that needs and code that actually needs to call these methods can't work until the UOE is replaced by an actual implementation. What am I missing?

While reviewing the code I feel there are some code cleanup / refactoring that we can do in `Fetcher` (not in the scope of this PR). 

For example, `updateFetchPositions()` is only triggered in `KafkaConsumer#updateFetchPositions()`, in which `resetOffsetsIfNeeded()` is always triggered beforehand, so inside that function these two conditions `subscriptions.committed(tp) == null` and `subscriptions.isOffsetResetNeeded(tp)` should never be true unless it is used in unit tests; maybe we can tighten the logic a bit for such cases in a separate PR?
I think the main thing we want to get in is the request/response implementations. I'm fine merging the producer API stubs later.
Yes, we can merge the API's once we have real implementations. The RPCs are more important.
LGTM. Merged to trunk and cherry-picked to 0.10.2, thanks @bbejeck !
Sounds good to me.
Merged to trunk and 0.10.2 branches.
Merged to trunk and 0.10.2 branches.

Updated. Thanks @hachikuji @guozhangwang

> What's the motivation behind this (with one window segment the changelog topic may still have lots of log segments)?

If we use delete then we will be deleting data that belongs in the segment. Or maybe it doesn't matter as it should obey the retention period anyway. Yeah i think that is right! Ok i'll change that back! Thanks

We run a single fork in all Apache Jenkins jobs. That's why we added the config. This change may be worthwhile if it makes the test suite faster in people's laptops/desktops.

@ijuma oh ok, that's a letdown (the Jenkins thing) :( (thanks for the hint though, this is quite valuable in ruling out sources of instability ! :))

I like that change obviously, but I can just as well put the config to 4, so whatever you decide :)
@gwenshap ping, I think the test illustrates the issue properly now :)

I have been thinking about it, but I feel it is not a blocking issue for `0.10.2` so did not cherry-pick when merging.

The newly added unit test hangs (cc @bbejeck ):

```

org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.RegexSourceIntegrationTest > shouldAddStateStoreToRegexDefinedSource STARTED
Build timed out (after 180 minutes). Marking the build as aborted.
Build was aborted
Recording test results
Setting GRADLE_2_4_RC_2_HOME=/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/tools/hudson.plugins.gradle.GradleInstallation/Gradle_2.4-rc-2
```
retest this please.
